description: Hands down, the best falafel I've had in San Francisco.  Always fresh and deliciously crispy.  The vibe here is pretty mellow, and the staff is friendly.  Next time you don't want to cook for a pot-luck, swing by here and pick up a couple dozen falafel to go!
author: Megan J.

description:
this is where i had my first falafel as a tween.  that was a looooonng time ago!

and i still come here cause they have the best falafels in town!

but i don't understand why they charge me tax every time i order the half dozen falafels.  

i don't get taxed on pork buns or tacos, so why falafels?  it makes me feel like they're trying to rip me off.  it's the principle, ya know?  less one star for that.
author: Josie M.

description:
If you're out in the Sunset and yearning for some middle eastern quick food, this place is a good stop.  I've had the falafel sandwiches and chicken shawarma.  Both are solid options that I would certainly order again.
The food here is far better than the middle eastern place on Irving and 7th, so if you're in the vicinity it is worth going the extra blocks.
author: Leo S.

description: BEST FALAFEL IN TOWN is no joke!!! These guys outshine all other falafel/ Mediterranean restaurants in the whole bay area as far as I'm concerned. Great vegetarian options, fresh locally grown organic produce and daily made everything (hummus, babaganouj, falafel...etc), Halal grade meat. And every location (San Francisco and Berkley) holds up to their best falafel in town standards. I have been a die hard patron of Sunrise Deli for the past 10 years and will hopefully continue frequenting this great Bay Area Mediterranean Deli for many years to come!
author: Peter B.

description:
I've been craving falafel for months now and I'm happy to say that the falafel craving has finally been satisfied.  And to think it was satisfied in the middle of Irving's Asian-town.  You see tapicoa places, Thai restaurants, Chinese BBQ places, and then this?  A deli/convenience store selling Middle Eastern foods and a small selection of Middle Eastern goods?  Needless to say, it was a surprise, but after eating here, its easy to see why its stil around in the neighborhood.

After doing some business in the area, I decided to stop here with my brother to try their falafel sandwich ($4.99).  We decided to share the regular sandwich, which is still pretty big - basically, its two sandwiches as the pita is sliced in half and then stuffed on both ends with lettuce, tomato, hummus, and falafel with a few pickled beets and green olives on the side.  (I shudder to think what would have happened to our poor, full stomachs had we ordered the super falafel...)  We found that the falafel was pretty good - crispy on the outside, not too oily, and moist on the inside.  It wasn't as warm as I would have preferred as the falafel didn't come straight out of the fryer.  The hummus was a little lacking in taste - it had the right texture and consistency, but the taste was a little off.  The sandwich itself could have used some heat - I'm used to getting hot sauce in my falafel sandwich.  It would have also helped had the pita bread been heated a little bit.  Normally, I don't think thats a problem, but this pita was a little stiff.

We took some things to-go as well, such as their baklava (both pistachio and walnut, $1.50 each) and more falafel balls (6 for $1.85, a dozen for $3.50).  The walnut baklava was pretty good, but the pistachio baklava was a disappointment, as the whole pistachios in the filling were soft and slightly stale.  The falafel balls are an excellent deal and great to construct your own sandwiches in the comfort of your home.  The countermen were nice and took care of things quickly.  Overall, this is a great place to pick up some Middle Eastern delicacies.  I'm definitely heading back to pick up more falafel and try more items, such as the chicken shwarma.
author: Angela H.

description: I was so excited to try this place. Such a disappointment. The meat wasn't even hot. Will not come here again.
author: Alvina C.

description: This place has the best falafel I've tasted. Crispy on the outside, soft and warm on the inside. Hummus is GREAT, by my standards lol. The shawarma plates are must-tries too, especially the lamb plate. OMG. I love this place!
author: Michelle B.

description: I've only tried Falafel at 2-3 other places and I gotta say this place has the best one! I always get the avocado falafel and they do load it up with some decent amounts of 'cado most of the time. Depends on how they're feeling I guess because sometimes I get a lot and sometimes its just a sliver.
author: Derrick L.

description:
Okay so....I'm back to review this place again after trying more items on the menu. I take it back, this place deserves five stars.  And that in spite of the major 'tude I've been getting from the short boy behind the counter (he's irritated that I asked for no tahini on my husband's shawarma). 
The owner is really nice whenever I come in, especially when I bring my baby girl with me. He even gave me a falafel on the house when I told him I'd never tried one before. 
The chicken shawarma is always great but I've discovered the veggie plate and may never go back. For starters, it's enormous! $5 for enough food for two lunches (ask for an extra falafel or two). I got it without the babaganouj because I don't like eggplant. They gave me an extra helping of hummus. The tabbouleh is wonderful (it has chunks of cucumber in it, which I love!  I don't know if that's authentic but I don't care - it's great!) and they also give you a generous portion of cucumber/tomato salad. 

They don't have the best help there (like I said, the boy behind the counter gives me attitude frequently), but the owner is nice and the food is exceptional. Any time I want friends to sample good local food, I take them here. I'm so happy this place is right down the street from my apartment!
author: Laura G.

description: This my friends is as good as it gets in the world of falafel!   This is the gold standard by which all falafel balls are judged (in my humble opinion).  These people know falafel!   Most of the time it is either hot out of the oil or freshly made and still warm.   It's moist and delish!    Pair it with the cucumber yogurt sauce, cucumber & tomato salad, dolmas, pitas & a nice piece of feta  and you will have an amazing meal!   The people behind the counter are friendly.  When I lived near by in the Sunset I would always take falafel balls w/ pitas and humus to parties or potlucks (they are cheap!).  Everyone would ask me where I got them.   It's a good thing in the sleepy Sunset.
author: Diana D.

description: THE BEST FALAFEL this side of the Jordan River.  Better than Bongo Burger in Berkeley.  So frickin' tasty and moist and yummy, with a nice kick of spice (sadly rare in many a bland, dry falafel), and you can get 2 dozen balls for about $6 ($3.25 for a dozen) - enough to cater a party with.   Which I have, multiple times.  I can't remember their other dishes since I mostly order the falafel and dolmas -- mmmmm, dolhhhhhmaaaaaass -- but I'm sure everything else is just as deelish.
author: VFSeamonkey M.

description: I buy 3 falafel and 4 dolmas. When I open the bag at home, I have 4 falafel and 5 dolmas. Wait, did I just count that right? 1...2...3... Yup, an extra of each.  But I didn't ask f--  Ohhhhh....well I'll be darned.
author: M A N I K.

description: My quest for the perfect falafel has ended. Crispy, tasty, all-around yummy.
author: Beth T.

description: Best Mediterranean food ever. That means it beats the pants off of any other Med place I have been to in the city. My BF (whose family is from Israel) even said it was the closest to authentic that he has ever had here and legend even has it that the place was bombed in the 80s. I think that means they're keepin it real.
author: Nicole S.

description:
It's all about the falafel here, plain and simple.  It seems the secret is not to subject the delicate mixture to factoryesque pre-rolling routine, but instead to let it be free and easy, only rolled into balls just before frying.  This way, the outer crust of the balls never congeal or harden, leaving a loose texture which allows the oil to distribute more evenly throughout.  The result is like trying falafel again for the first time, the right way!
Keeping with the simple approach, it follows that the regular falafel is the best.  Avocado would only distract from the falafel flavor I feel, so I won't try that despite my love for the creamy fruit in all kinds of uses.  I did try the deluxe, which is definitely a step down.  It comes in a burrito shape wrapped in lavash, which I found only compresses the falafel and forces dryness on it.  Stick with the classic pita, moist and loose, a perfect fit for the falafel balls that adorn it ;)
author: El I.

description: THE BEST FALAFEL IN SF.  So I love Falafel and I've been to tons of mediteranean places in SF but this place is amazing.  Talk about no frills - it's a deli and closes early, but you can buy their falafel batter for home if you want to eat it late.  It's a dollar or two over the avg or what you'd expect in the sunset, but well worth it!
author: Jared F.

description: Wow. Greek/ Mediterranean food never tasted better, especially because of the prices here [= a DOZEN falafels for only $3.50! Seriously can't beat that. I'm totally in love with their hummus,  I've been ever since I first discovered what it really was a month ago. I love how Sunrise is located right next to 22nd irving too, two of the best stores in the neighborhood.
author: Colleen W.

description:
The avocado falafell may be the best thing I have ever had(when I am looking for something healthy to eat). It has an amazingly fresh flavor and leaves me completely full, yet not comatosed. 

I have been here over a dozen times and they never cease to amaze me with their quality.  It is one of those hidden gems in the city.
author: Ryan M.

description: THEIR FALAFELS ARE AMAZING!!!! Sometimes I just get one in a napkin.. mm.. the spices, texture, and heat are perfect. Wow. My friend and I got a half dozen today for only $1.85. The cashier even gave us some free tahini sauce on the side! My classmate brought about 30 of them in for a French party and I put them in crepes and they were sooooo delicious. Mm.. the falafel sandwich is also outstanding, as is the chicken shwarma sandwich. YUM!!
author: O K.

description: Great customer service. Dining is quick, simple, and clean. The food hits the spot.
author: David R.

description:
Having grown up eating Lebanese food, Sunrise Deli has become my go-to when I am craving a quick middle eastern food meal.  

The SF location has been the most consistent but all the locations are good and small enough to feel personal.

Their falafel, shawarma, and hummus are all consistently excellent.

You seat yourself, the food comes quickly with all the fixings, and you can top the meal with a variety of tasty desserts that I believe they prepare.

There can be a wait when things get busy and good luck finding parking at peak hours but a small price for an inexpensive tasty meal
author: Nareg R.

description:
the people here are unassuming, friendly and helpful, regardless of the fact you might not know a damn thing about mediterranean cuisine. the falafel are indeed - fresh, handmade, crisp, hot, toasty, aromatic, and just perfect clouds. 

everything else is hiding under the glass, waiting for you to order, as well as hordes of pastries already stacked up on a rack upon entering, prepacked and ready to buy. 

these guys try too hard. i wish others would try just as hard.
author: Ben T.

description:
don't come here looking for gyros, this is not a greek place, it's Mediterranean. i said "do you guys have gyros?" and the guy yelled "SHAWARMA!" anyways, i got the lamb shawarma plate and it's comparable to any good gyros plate, BUT I THINK IT'S BETTER (more flavor). 

everyone there is really nice. i told the older dude (maybe the owner?) that i saw this place on yelp and he gave us free falafel. very kind =)

oh yeah, the only bad thing is that i don't like their tzatziki  b/c it has HUGE chucks of cucumber. this of course will not stop me from eating it. 

that's all!
author: T V.

description: Despite the looks of the place, any newcomer would be amazed by the food! The falafel is some of the best I have ever eaten and the lamb shawarma is impressive. Everything is made in a timely manner and the owner is friendly. Great place to pick up a quick lunch.
author: Brian W.

description: My boss brings us lunch at the office every once in a while, but one thing's always for sure... He goes to Sunrise Deli. Why? He's Israeli, Vegetarian, and loves falafels.  I am most definitely a fan. Best falafels in the city!
author: MJ T.

description: This place makes really good falafels. I also like the lentils with rice comes with crunchy onions on top or mixed in (cant remember). Spinach Pies are large and filled with lots of feta and spinach. They also have this Mediterranean pizza with meat it's good but beware very spicy.
author: Stacey T.

description: This place is great.  Tabouli and hummus with falafel is really good.  The owner is also very nice -- totally satisfied with this place and will be back for more!
author: Jennifer Y.

description: Best falafal ever. That is all. And it's all you need to know.
author: Suzi G.

description: This always happens.  You plan a party way in advance.  Work suddenly becomes insane and you don't have time to home-make any of the stuff that you were planning.  Much less, do a quick vacuum and stock the booze.  A quick phone call here will save your bacon.  We put in an order for a Mediterranean platter on Sat. evening.  By Sunday 10:30am, they were ready to go and our guests were rockin' the baba ganoush, falafel, the best tabbouli, assorted cold salad, extra pitas -- beautifully presented.  All for a very reasonable price.
author: K W.

description:
The desserts and CHICKEN shawarma were great! 4.5 stars for that. 

The LAMB shawarma was terrible. I mean terrible. So tough and chewy it was completely inedible. We ended up splitting the flavorful and tender chicken one, which isn't enough food for two. Very disappointing for a place with 4 stars. We wanted to order something else to replace the lamb one, but there was a such a long line the whole time we were there and the cooks paid no attention to anyone already seated. They also never brought us the falafel that is supposedly so delicious. 

It was good enough to come back and try again.
author: Lynn M.

description:
Two words: Super Falafel!

Mouth-watering tasty.

Hot.

Fresh.

I was craving it as soon as I woke up.

I'm eating one right now. Yum!
author: Spicy T.

description: After Moses walked out of the desert from Egypt, he asked for the chicken shawarma and a half dozen dolmas.  Yeah, they're good.
author: Eric G.

description:
I love falafel.

I had been craving it for weeks and weeks and so I made a little afternoon excursion to Sunrise Deli after Yelping it hardcore and discovering that this was apparently the best place to get those deep-fried balls of joy. It wasn't too out of my way... just a thirty-minute bus ride. 

I ordered half-a-dozen because I envisaged eating one warm falafel on the way home, and saving the others for sandwiches throughout the week. That didn't happen. I ate them all before I walked through my front door. And the thing is, they were so freakin' tasty that I don't even feel bad. They had the perfect crispy, crunchy exterior and soft, moist inside that most falafel balls strive for, but never achieve.  I still think about the crunch sometimes...  

I had a very burpy, fat night, but I'd do it again given half the chance.
author: Sophie K.

description: I ate here awhile back and was pleasantly suprised.  I'd been in the area numerous times before and never even noticed this place was here until I read about it on SFGate.  I had the falafel wrap and it was good.  I still prefer Old Jerusalem to Sunrise but prefer Sunrise to Yummas if that helps.
author: M M.

description: Falafels! The best in the city are made here...no matter what time of day you go in, they are always frying a fresh batch of those delectable fried garbanzo bean balls. For about $3, you could get enough to fill 2 pita pockets with hummus and fresh veggies...I have never tried a combo from here, only ordered falafels to-go. Also try their baba ganoush (eggplant), but their hummus is only ok. I would go for a small tub of Trader Joe's hummus.
author: Jessica h.

description: Their falafel is the best. Although I like their shawarma a lot, my favorite is the vegetarian plate; everything on it is delicious. When I go there with my 6 yr old son they fawn all over him. Straightforward and friendly service.
author: Heather R.

description: Best falafel in SF! 'Nuff said.
author: Philip G.

description:
Take this review with a pinch of sunset salt. I was literally starving for lunch after a long and busy morning without a breakfast start. I decided to try Sunrise Deli after living in the area for nearly 3 years and never having noticed the place located in between two groceries. Overall it was quite a pleasant surprise and I really enjoyed the lamb shawarma.
I might get disappointed next time, but I will definitely come back.
author: Cedrick C.

description:
Falafel by the dozen. It's a take out place although they have a few tables  over. But they look like waiting-for-your-to-go-order tables. 
Besides falafel they have an assorted selection of mediterranean food ( I believe the owner is from Pakistan ). Falafels are just superb. They're always busy cooking them. Get your bag of falafels and enjoy a picnic in a park -  Golden gate park is two blocks away.
Don't forget: Falafels by the dozen. - about half dozen here on this review already. Need to get back there.
author: Paula T.

description: Everythig here is great.Especially the homemade right there in front of you falafels. Nice people too
author: Danny G.

description: So I'm sheltered I've never had a falafel my entire life. I have no idea what it is but feeling adventurous I thought why the hell not. Anything coming out of a deep fryer must not be bad. I'm so happy I tried it and  it has become my new obsession. That and  their baklava. Have you ever had a moment where you are eating something and the whole world stands still and all you are thinking is how delicious it is? Baklava will take you to that magical place
author: Sophia C.

description: the falafel, hummus and baklava is so awesome.  I love this jewel in my neighborhood.
author: Ruby G.

description: I have passed by this place many times over the years, but I never tried it. I remembered this place as the place with the gyros, as I would see the meat slab piled high whenever I passed by. This was my first time and I tried the lamb shawarma and the falafels. They both left a lasting impression on me. The shawarmas are great, the pita bread is nice and soft. So much flavor mixed in together, creating a combination that tastes so good. It is even better if you add some falafels. I do not regret coming here and I will surely be back to try what else they have to offer.
author: Nelson G.

description: Best falafel you will ever eat! If you don't know what a falafel is, you need to try it. I did and now I'm a falafeller!
author: Kimberly H.

description:
i have been going to this place for several years & the food is still good, even after a change in ownership a year or two ago.  the food is still the same,  authentic, very delicious & filling.  i typically order the lamb shawarma & my wife will get the falafel.  the hummus is always fresh & good.  the falafel are always fresh, best to get them when they are hot & out of the deep fryer.  the the prices are still very reasonable for what you getting.  

i would recommend the lamb shawarma on lavash if its available, otherwise pita bread is always good.
author: larry s.

description: The best falafel I have had so far in SF!! Granted it is a bit out of my way, I will definitely be coming back here soon to eat falafel and try the rest of the food on their menu. The service was quick and the cashier was very nice. And to boot, they sell falafel buy the 1/2 dozen and dozen for very reasonable prices ($1.85 & $3.00). I just wish they had a deli closer to where I live so I didn't have to trek out to the Sunset.
author: Bathrooms Only ..

description: I love this place.  It's a hole in the wall deli,  but has great mediterranean food.  I especially like their shawarma over hummus plate.
author: Lucas M.

description: The falafel shwerma is worth trying.  Ate the whole thing in one sitting, and I rarely finish my food.
author: Jeanne L.

description: Can't believe I walked by this place all these years and didn't try it.  After finding such high reviews on Yelp, I immediately proceeded to walk to Sunrise and ordered two felafel's.  The cashier was pleasant and courteous.  I received my order in a matter of minutes and took it straight home.  After the first few bites, I knew I would be re-visiting Sunrise in the future.  The felafel's was perfect, aromatic and wrapped in a warm pita bread.  The portions were also generous for the price.  I would definitely recommend them.
author: David P.

description: Excellent falafel, reasonable prices, great vegan/vegetarian options!
author: Maximilian M.

description: YUM! Falafel that's fresh, chicken shawarma that has full flavors and drink refrigerator sliding doors that slide with ease. Yes, it's just a hole in the wall... a flower among a bunch of identical other little markets and restaurants but everything is made to order and the employees are friendly
author: Alden C.

description:
I've tried lots of falafel, and I've never had a sandwich better than this one. The falafel is always hot and steaming. It's not made in the morning so it can sit around all day.

***
2011 edit
The last two times I came here my falafel was delivered cold. I fear that standards have slipped now that the store has expanded to 4 locations. Unfortunately, you might have to ask for fresh falafel now when ordering. If I didn't have to make this comment, I would maintain the five-star rating.
author: Michael L.

description: Nice change of pace in the midst of grocery stores and asian markets.  I am only giving my review on their vegetarian items.  The falafel balls are good:  crunchy on the outside, moist and tasty on the inside.  They do seem to like making the rest of their items tart and lemony.  Don't get me wrong, i love the lemon but when it's used as accompaniment to the ingredients as opposed to being the main ingredient, i do prefer it to be more subtle.   There was too much lemon in the hummus and the dolmas.  The baba ganoush was lightly smokey and a few of the other veggie items in their vegetarian plate was good but could also use a smidgeon less lemon.  I want to taste the other ingredients other than the lemon overpowering everything!!!
author: Animal K.

description: Very nice selection of Middle Eastern food (sweets and savories) for very cheap.  Plenty of veggie options, too.  $4.99 for a regular falafel sandwich, $5.50 for an avocado falafel sandwich.  One thing that could be improved is thicker pita to keep the sandwich from falling apart as you eat it, but it was still very tasty all the same.
author: Lynn O.

description: This place has such great Felafel's and they're super cheap. When ever I'm in the neighborhood, I have to stop here and get at least a dozen.  My mom introduced me to these tasty treats because she was out with her bf and got a free sample. It was a whole falafel each! I think that's how they get you suckered into getting them. Once you have one, you want at least 5 more.  Their lentil rice is very tasty and so is the baklava.  I love the location too because I can get a boba, dim sum and felafel's all within 2 blocks of each other.
author: Mara L.

description: Tried their chicken shawarma on lavash.  The chicken was good, but I felt that it lacked certain elements.  Kind of plained compared to the shawarmas I had before.  That being said, flavor was good.  3.5 stars.  Friendly service.
author: Katniss B.

description: We stumbled upon this place last week and YUM!! My husband had the shwarma which he loved and I must say their falafel is the best I've ever had - I got the plate and made my own sandwich with pita. Good prices and good customer service too!
author: Amy T.

description: Had the vegetarian party platter and two pounds each of the kufta and chicken kabob. I was a little hesitant about the price ($130) but the smell alone on the way home alleviated those fears. Everything was great. The only setback was that my party guests were trying to swipe the leftovers!
author: Robert K.

description: Their sign should read -- Sunrise Deli & Cafe, Home to the Best Falafels in San Francisco --.  I'm forever indebted to my friend Basil for introducing me to this place.  They're especially good after a long day of drinking and a run-in with the San Francisco's "finest."
author: Jon P.

description: This review is tinged with nostalgia since I haven't been in more than twice since the ownership changed. The food is still delicious, but I miss the old crew. They would toss falafels high into the air for you to catch the moment you walked in, sizzling hot from the fryer. It helped that they were some of the best falafels I've ever had, wonderfully spiced and soft as can be. The shwarmas are also terrific, big chunks of lamb and lovely hummus, tahini, seasoned onions and tabouli (all of which can be bought separately, to go. The pitas they come in have a nasty habit of splitting open, so prepare to use the plastic fork they give you. If you're looking for a cheap and quick snack, grab a half dozen falafel and a ring bread (think giant sesame bagel) to go. The food is all still very good, but it's run it's course for me... but you should definitely give it a shot.
author: Cameron S.

description: Probably some of the best falafel and schwarmas in the City.  The falafels are usually fresh with just the right texture (not too much oil) and taste.  Lamb schwarmas are great, seasoned and cooked right so it's not gamy.
author: Kenneth L.

description: I LOVE this place.  The falafel is the best I've ever had in the US, warm, crunchy exterior, flavorful, fresh interior.  And the tahini is really delicious, unusual that it has shredded/diced cucumber in it.  The people that own this place are really nice too, I feel welcome whenever I enter the door.
author: Josie B.

description: I always go here when I have to bring something for a pot luck, party or quick get together.  There falafels are always fresh and inexpensive.  I pick up some bread and hummus too.  I was not very impressed with their shawarma, however.
author: Pat S.

description: Munching on their Super Falafel right now and it is delicious as usual.
author: Jeremiah A.

description: The best Falafels I have found in SF.  The place is nothing to look at and is not a "date night" place; Its kind of a cross between a grocery and a deli. Go there for the food. The owner is a great guy too
author: mack m.

description:
very very yummy falafel. even better when straight from the deep fryer [sometime around 11am or noon is the freshest]. when i saw the dude behind the counter freshly frying some falafel, i just walked myself in the shop and HAD to get myself a half-dozen of falafel. hot and crispy and not to mention very greasy, the falafel is simply delicious. 
the lamb shawarmas i had some time back was okay, it did not taste that great or awful. the peak of its flavor is right after the shawarma is made, so it's best to consume then. the lamb is delicious, so i'd give sunrise deli props for that.
author: Court L.

description: Since Just Like Home left Irving Street west of 19th Avenue years ago.  Thanks to Yelpers we tried a falafel sandwich at Sunrise and loved it.  The falafels are crispy on the outside and soft inside just as others have described it and served with tahini.   In short, a delicious, no frills falafel.  Prices are reasonable, service is prompt.  I wish they had whole wheat pita bread.
author: M.D. L.

description: Great for a simple and quick lunch - reasonable prices, yummy Mediterranean food, and their 5 tables are sufficient - most people get food to go here! They also have a small grocery to augment the deli.  More a neighborhood gem than anything else, but it's all delicious!
author: Michael S.

description: Their much ballyhooed "best falafel in San Francisco" is indeed pretty good, especially if you get there right after a fresh batch has been fried. I usually just go for the sandwiches, either the super falafel in a lavash tube or the smaller pita bread version. I have come to prefer the pita bread falafel sandwich, because the falafel doesn't get as soggy, and thus retains more of its crispiness without fading into the starchy potatoes that reside in the super falafel. Also worth mentioning is their excellent tahini sauce, rich with parsley flavor. While I would hesitate at calling this or any falafel the best--different falafels can be good for different reasons--this is definitely one of the more craveworthy ones.
author: Nicky G.

description: I would say it's the best falafel in a city full of extremely average mid-eastern food.  Lets remember it is no more then a deli and just enjoy the fact that some people are still content with just doing a couple things really well..
author: Milo G.

description: Definitely the most satisfying falafel sandwiches in San Francisco. The secret is the crunchiness, which is just right.
author: Nick S.

description:
used to go there more often,i went there today and i have things to say.
the falafel is not like it used to be,so flat and dry, like these people never seen a falafel before.i wasn't happy at all.
author: sami w.

description: Love theri falafel, but i wish they wash their hands more, i got some falafel last week and the girl was on the cash ringing people up, and i asked her if i can have 4 ring breads, she didn't even wash her hands, with her bare hands, she grabbed my bread, i asked her don't u wash before u touch the food, and she said no..GROSS, next time, i will pick out my own bread, or i will just walk out
author: leena m.

description: Grew up on this kind of food and always looking to recapture the old days. This was some of the best middle-eastern food I have had in years. Cheap and fast and fresh. Falafel was incredible and Turkish coffee rocked
author: Jake H.

description: Best falafel ever!!  So fresh, authentic, and crisp, not dry at all.  I love the avocado falafel sandwich--completely delicious!  Service is friendly and speedy.  Good prices.  If you love falafel, get yourself here in a hurry.  Don't bother getting falafel anywhere else but here!
author: Paula L.

description: Tried the Regular Falafel Sandwich today. Their falafel is indeed good. I've had falafel, count em, 4 times in my life. Till today I had known them to be dry, rather hard balls of stuff heavily seasoned with herbs.  These falafel were crisp on the outside and creamy on the inside (no allusions to recently released catchy and overplayed hip hop ditties intended). The flavor was just right and not too herby. The sandwich was filled with tomato, lettus, hummus, and this stuff that I don't know how to describe but it was like mashed up herbs, which I found tasty. Though it looked small, it was extremely filling. I was full after eating the first half of my sammich. This place has redeemed itself. I will be back for a plate of some sort next time. Babaganhouj perhaps.
author: Polly F.

description: Thinking about the falafal and the chicken plate with tabbouleh and tomato cucumber salad on the side makes my tummy happy! I've been coming here for YEARS, my mom used to bring me to get falafel when I was little, this place by far has the best falafel in town! HANDS DOWN. and I've had my share of falafel, finding out that there is one in Berkeley too just made my heart smile. The price is reasonable, the food is good, and the service, well it isn't impressive, but I don't exactly go for the service.
author: S A.

description: im sorry. i had to. there was a long piece of hair in mine. and although it was a good falafel.. the hair ruined it for me. i dont think i can eat there again.
author: L M.

description: Hands down, best felafel in the city, by far.  Its nice and fresh, i love it.  Get the avacado or super felafel, they are so tasty.  The swarmas are pretty good too.  The guys who work there are cool too, and the little old guy who owns it is very friendly and generous too.  This one time i was like 12 cents short on cash, and he let me slide, sweet.
author: Daniel P.

description:
go there for falafel. but when it cools down you have to heat them up again - not in microwave but 15mins in oven.
and very good cuke yogurt sauce.
place isn't spiffy new, verging on run down dirty really, but it's cheap & yummy.
author: Kim Y.

description: Not good at all. Large platter plate  looked more like a small portion in a large container. Plain humus, cold meat. The lady filled a container with the salad, thought for a minute and took some of the salad out - that's how we realized it won't be good from here.  Come on - we were excited to become regulars there, that's not gonna happen.....
author: Sashie G.

description: Great falafel sandwiches!  Every month or so, we will come up from San Mateo County just to get our 'fix' here. It is worth the drive.  Nothing fancy about the place or the service, just good tasty food.
author: Russell B.

description: This is my favorite place to get falafel! It is very good and definitely very fresh.  I definitely think it is the best in San Francisco. They have good hummus too! This place makes my tummy happy.
author: Miranda R.

description: awesome falafel! if you can order the falafel outside of a sandwhich, get some fixins and your own pita, your legs will loosen up and you'll fall to the floor. that's a good thing, of course.
author: Antoi C.

description: my best friend and i were craving gyros since we got back from  new york so we decided to drive down irving to find a place and ran in to this little cafe. we saw that they made there falafels fresh and the gyros were really good and stuffed with fresh veggies and sauce. i recommend eating it there while it is fresh before it gets soggy...we would definitely come back again.
author: Linda L.

description: the worst customer service.  slow,rude and discusting food.  the employes are cusing behind the counter, i also heard there are mice and rats in the resturant that go in the food and that they dont care and that they blend and grind them in  the falafel.  never again .  if i can give 0 stars i would. also the male employee called me a foul name.  i do not recommend this dump.
author: ru r.

description:
i hate writing bad reviews. but it's also the only time i'm moved enough to write a review. [note to self: start writing some good reviews]

i saw the sign and suddenly had a craving for a great lamb shawarma. which made me super excited to eat here... and i think this is what doomed them.

i like big shawarmas. i have never seen such a sad shawarma with so little meat. maybe it was just the people who were working at that moment, cuz they weren't very friendly (or even happy)... 

order at the register, and if you dine-in they will serve you at the table. the server didn't know what he was giving us, so don't ask any questions.

the store itself is fine, nothing fancy but hey, it's a deli. at least there is a cool selection of canned and bottled goods to look at and attempt to read =)

with all these great reviews, i would give it another shot. i would just pick something else... something that i'm not excited about and i don't expect to have meat on.
author: sina t.

description: i ordered the large hummuus platter that came with pita bread. it was alright..got sick of it because there was so much olive oil.the bf got the falafel sandwich which was really good! i knwo wat to order the next time im around irving.
author: christy w.

description: i have only ate the a few times but sweet moses the falafel is off the hook, ive also had the hummus there and its sound as well great place friendly staff and even better food check em out
author: dan m.

description: The falafels here are pretty tasty, but not anything amazing- I'm thinking a 3.5 rating. I imagine they would be a good snack to have around the house, not year-long, of course. I actually care about my arteries. Still, the falafels are moist, well-seasoned and as cheap as dim sum. Currently, I am fantasizing about baked falafels. Do they exist, or would baking falafels be an act of blasphemy in the eyes of falafel fanatics?
author: Anita L.

description: I did not know what a falafel was until a week ago.  I read some reviews on Yelp raving on and on about this place and decided to buy one of these crunchy fried balls.  I walked in and was immediately greeted by the guy.  I asked for 1 falafel and almost got away with getting it for free until the owner stepped in and charged me for it.  He said in a rough but playful tone, "Now, next time, you're getting MORE."  I was a bit bewildered, but the falafel totally ROCKEd!  It was crunchy on the outside a soft and warm on the inside.  It was even better since they just finished frying it. Yummmmmmm.  I have yet to try the other things on their menu, but I promise to give it a shot.
author: Connie P.

description: Uhh, I don't think so ... my lamb schwarma was warmed up in the microwave right in front of me (instead of being carved right on the meat totem) and is chewy and completely flavorless and drowning in tahini. If you can't get the basics right you can fugetaboudit.
author: Hopping J.

description: Their Falafel are the only game in town. Fresh out of the oil, they are at their dreamiest!
author: Maximilian A.

description: Really good falafel balls. Crispy and flavorful. Just stick with the falafel sandwiches.  Everything else is blah.  Hummus is watery.
author: Will M.

description: Let me put it simply...Sunrise Deli has the best falafel in San Francisco and possibly the world and i have been all over.  Fresh, crisp, incredibly delicious.  Every friend i have turned on to this gem of a place totally agrees.  By the way, i always also order the rice, lentil, fried onion dish as well.   It goes perfectly with the falafel.  The owner is totally friendly and wants you to be happy.   Sunrise Deli is a really great find especially if you appreciate fantastic falafel!
author: JUSTIN G.

description: Love this place! Its just around the corner from where I live so this place definitely has helped me with many hangovers!
author: Cody P.

description: The place and employees are a little unfriendly and gruff, but the shawarmas are pretty good. Its worth it if you want a quick decent bite.
author: Varun B.

description: We had heard good things about this place, so when my brother and his wife were visiting from out of town (a couple of years ago) we suggested that they grab a bit there. She ordered some kind of lamb meat ball off of the countertop (not refrigerated). That night she got sick to her stomach, and by morning she had a high temperature and was semi-incoherent, when her eyes rolled back in her head we realized we had to carry her to the car and rush her to St. Mary's hospital. At the hospital they said she had BAD food poisoning and they had to giver her meds and pump her full of fluid using an IV. She spent the next three days watching TV Land on our couch, stuck in a loop of old Bonanza and I Dream of Genie -- not the trip to SF they had hoped for. I called the owner of the restaurant and told him. He was VERY apologetic and promised he would make sure it never happened again, that he'd take steps to handle/store the food differently. I'd say be careful what you order there, you may "get" more than you bargain for.
author: Jessica F.

description: outstanding!  i come in for the falafels by the dozen!  and that's for under $4.
author: meijan w.
